reviews.text: Plenty of restaurants and bars in and around the station. Good connections with underground. Fast trains to Birmingham, NW and Glasgow

Convenient station, considering it's connected to multiple underground lines and national rail. Some shops and restaurants are also available inside this station. However, it is always busy and needs an expansion to cope with increasing travellers

Too many people go in the Euston station  go any where .the people come back from London and the people want get cab .this is very bad road like for bus and car drive to pass Euston station cab can not stay riad no good mean heath safe pass not look back and front see the people walking cross road

This review is concerning the toilets at Euston. The gents toilet on the afternoon of Friday 18th October were an absolute disgrace. This is a major terminus in London and should be in a reasonable condition 24 hours a day. I dread to think what visitors to this country must think.  Sort yourselves out.

Great station for travelling to many destinations with a great array of shops and areas to prepare for your journey. Lots of restaurants and cafes to eat at before getting an evening train, and very easy ticket pick up options. Definitely recommend getting to your platform before the train is due to depart if it’s a long journey to get a good seat.
